Class FileSystemTree

java.lang.Object
FileSystemTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class FileSystemTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
FileSystemTree class is created to handle a file system hierarchy in a general tree structure.

TÃ¼rker Tercan

    • addDir

      private void addDir​(java.lang.String[] tokens, FileSystemTree.FileNode localRoot, int n)
      Recursive method addDir Prints an error message if want to add node under a file Or tokens name does not found
      Parameters:
      tokens - nodes' name that is already splatted
      localRoot - root of that subtree
      n - level of localRoot

      deleteNode - node that will be removed

    • removeElements

      private void removeElements​(FileSystemTree.FileNode localRoot)
      The method is recursively prints all elements of localRoot and ask the user wants to remove it or not

    • search

      private void search​(FileSystemTree.FileNode localRoot, FileSystemTree.FileNode mainRoot, java.lang.String name)
      Recursive method search It searches every node if contains that name. if it is prints its path
      Parameters:
      localRoot - the root of local subtree
      mainRoot - root of all tre
      name - String that is searching

    • printNode

      private void printNode​(FileSystemTree.FileNode node, FileSystemTree.FileNode localRoot, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path)
      Recursive method to print node's path
      Parameters:
      node - the node that path's will be printed
      localRoot - the root of local subtree
      path - contains all nodes.data to print when node is found
